d tu
quoque, a Latin term that means “you are another.” When a parent tells a child
to quit smoking, the child might respond, “Look who’s talking. You’ve been
smoking  for  years.  If  it’s  so  bad,  why  don’t  you  stop?”  The  force  of  this
charge might be just that the parent is hypocritical or that one has no right to
criticize others for doing something that one does oneself. If that is the point,
this response is a silencer, and it might or might not be justified. In any case,
the pare
